message.content:
<<<api>>>: JSONObject
<<<code>>>: 
String jsonString = serviceHandler.makeServiceCall(BASE_URL, ServiceHandler.GET);
JSONObject lights;
if (jsonString != null) {
    try {
        JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject(jsonString);
        JSONObject lightsObject = jsonObject.getJSONObject("lights");
        Iterator<String> keys = lightsObject.keys();
        while(keys.hasNext()) {
            String key = keys.next();
            JSONObject light = lightsObject.getJSONObject(key);
            String name = light.getString("name");
            String bri = light.getString("bri");
            String hue = light.getString("hue");
            String sat = light.getString("sat");
            String status = light.getString("on");
        }
    } catch (JSONException ex) {
        ex.printStackTrace();
    }
} else {
    Log.e("ServiceHandler", "Cannot get data from the url");
}
<<<explanation>>>: The data you are trying to parse is not a JSONArray but a JSONObject. You need to first get the JSONObject "lights" from your main JSONObject. Then, you can iterate over the keys of this JSONObject, which represent the individual lights. For each key, you can get the corresponding JSONObject and extract the data you need.
